New Records: This will be the first World Series featuring five MVPs: the Dodgers' Ohtani, Freeman, and Betts, and the Yankees' Aaron Judge and Giancarlo Stanton. This will be the first Series to feature both since 1971, and it will be the first with two 50-home run hitters (Judge with 58 and Ohtani with 54).
Key Match Events: Aaron Boone and Dave Roberts have a decades-old rivalry, and Jack Flaherty is returning to pitch in the World Series for the Dodgers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers and Yankees are the most followed and visible teams globally, with the highest TV ratings for the League Championship Series since 2017. The series is expected to be the starriest in decades due to the presence of top players and the historical rivalry.
Post-Match Reflections: Not directly mentioned in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers and Yankees rivalry dates back to 1941, and this will be the 12th meeting in 43 years. Hal Steinbrenner recalls the 1977 World Series win, highlighting the Yankees' legacy.
Others: The article notes that this is the fifth World Series since the Wild Card Era started in 1995, showing the progression of the playoffs.
